title: COMP/STAT112 Notebook
text:
Introduction
This is my online notebook for COMP/STAT112 course taken at Macalester College. Please, use the side bar on the left for navigation.

title: 4  Notes 1
text:
Chap 1: Steps: - Data Collection: - Data Preparation: - Data Visualization: - Data Analysis: - Data Storytelling:
Chap 2: Console is good for:
quick calculations
trying out code pulling up help files
Console is bad for most everything else, including… documenting our work editing our work communicating our work being able to reproduce our work
Quarto: Quarto and the console operate independently unless code chunks in Quarto are actively run, affecting their visibility and storage.

title: 5  Note 02
text:
Chap 3: ggplot2: - Part of the tidyverse package. - Implements the “grammar of graphics” to structure and generate plots. - Facilitates creating complex plots through a coherent system of components.
Chap 4: - Bar Charts: Ideal for categorical or discrete variables with a few outcomes.

Histograms: Best for quantitative variables with many outcomes, showing frequency distributions.
Scatter Plots: Great for visualizing relationships between two quantitative variables.
Density Plots: Useful for comparing distributions, with modifications like color to distinguish between groups.
